title: How well do you know the Boston Celtics? Take our history quiz.

title: One of Turtleboy blogger’s witness intimidation cases dropped after DA stuck without prosecutor
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Aidan Kearney still faces other criminal charges in connection with his coverage of Karen Read’s murder case.
A jubilant Aidan Kearney, also know as Turtleboy, throws up his fist to supporters outside Norfolk Country Superior Court in 2023.

It's different here.

title: Cambridge hits pause on license plate cameras amid privacy concerns
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News City officials voted to suspend the Flock Safety system while they review data-sharing practices with law enforcement.
A Flock Safety license plate reader.

Courtesy of Flock Safety Just months after approving them, the Cambridge City Council voted unanimously Monday to pause the city’s use of Flock Safety license plate reader cameras, citing growing concerns over privacy and data sharing.

title: South End arrests increased by 163% this summer, police say
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The sharp spike in arrests comes amid ongoing calls for city officials to rein in public drug use and related crime near Mass.
and Cass and the South End.
South End residents say that public drug use is a growing concern in their neighborhood.

title: 2 of America’s best small towns for Halloween are in New England, according to Fodor’s Travel
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel "In small town America, Halloween celebrations are next level.
" Costumed revelers walk through a graveyard in Salem.

Photo by JOSEPH PREZIOSO/AFP via Getty Images By Kristi Palma October 22, 2025 | 11:28 AM 1 minute to read Travelers in search of Halloween spirit this month will find a scary amount of it in two small New England towns, according to Fodor’s Travel.

title: ‘Verbally abusive’ Kentucky man forces plane to return to Logan gate

bullets: Crime The flight landed in Las Vegas almost four hours late after the interruption.

title: That’s a lotta bread: Panera founder gives $20 million to Mass. college
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Education Ron Shaich, class of 1976, has gifted his alma mater its largest single gift in history.
Ron Shaich, the founder of Panera, inside one of the chain locations in 2017.
Suzanne Kreiter/The Boston Globe The founder of Panera Bread has given Clark University its largest single gift in history.

title: Suspect in former Fall River mayor’s stabbing charged with assaulting police
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Corree Gonzales has not yet been charged in connection with Monday’s attack on former Mayor Will Flanagan.

By Abby Patkin October 22, 2025 | 10:15 AM 1 minute to read A suspect in the stabbing of former Fall River Mayor Will Flanagan was ordered held without bail Tuesday after he was accused of attacking the police officers who detained him.
Corree Gonzales, 31, faces four counts of assault and battery on a police officer, court records show.

title: ESPN analyst discussed the ‘most impressive’ thing about Drake Maye’s growth in 2025 season
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update Former NFL quarterback (now ESPN analyst) Dan Orlovsky also compared Maye to a Super Bowl winner.
Drake Maye warming up prior to the Patriots' win over the Titans.
